prior_works.title: Generalization without Systematicity: On the Compositional Skills of Sequence-to-Sequence Recurrent Networks
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Defined the systematic generalization challenge and supplied the SCAN evaluation that the attractor-based parsing model targets.

synthesis_narrative: The paper’s core innovation—modeling syntactic structure with modular continuous attractor dynamics and factorizing structure/content inputs in a prefrontal–hippocampal–entorhinal circuit—emerges from converging lines of theory, modeling, and empirical evidence in hippocampal/entorhinal neuroscience and compositional NLP. Foundational attractor-grid models (Fuhs & Touretzky, 2006; Burak & Fiete, 2009) supply the precise dynamical machinery—continuous attractors with modular, periodic codes—that the authors reuse to stabilize and traverse syntactic states, analogous to path integration over grid manifolds. Empirical demonstrations that grid-like codes also organize abstract concepts (Constantinescu et al., 2016) and theoretical accounts that hippocampal computations support generalization via predictive mapping (Stachenfeld et al., 2017) argue that navigation-derived mechanisms can extend to higher cognition, including language. The Tolman–Eichenbaum Machine (Whittington et al., 2020) operationalizes this bridge by showing grid/place systems can generalize relational structure beyond physical space, directly informing the authors’ design choice to encode compositional syntax with grid-like attractor modules. The paper’s second pillar—separate streams for structure and content—draws on MEC/LEC dissociations (Hargreaves et al., 2005), grounding the factorized input architecture in established hippocampal–entorhinal pathways for spatial (structural) versus non-spatial (content) information. Finally, the SCAN benchmark (Lake & Baroni, 2018) crystallizes the target phenomenon—systematic compositional generalization in command parsing—and provides the evaluation regime to test whether hippocampal-style attractor dynamics indeed yield more systematic language parsing.
